V: (L. f.) P. J. H. Hurter & Mabb.

cardinfo.CI: Senegalia - Black Cutch Tree/Black Cutch Tree - Canopy.jpg

V: Cutch tree is a small tree, growing 3-15 m high. The stem is dark brown to black, with rough bark which peels off in long strips in mature trees; young trees have corky bark. The fern-like leaves are 100-200 mm long and contain between 8 and 30 pairs of small leaves made up of numerous, oblong pairs of secondary leaflets 2-6 mm long. Glands occur on the stem below the first pair of leaves, and between the uppermost six pairs of leaves. Pairs of stout thorns up to 10 mm long are found at the base of each leaf. The flowers are white or pale yellow, about 3 mm long and bunched tightly together to form a cylindrical flower spike, 35-75 mm long, resembling a lamb's tail. The brown, beaked seed pods are 50-125 mm long on a short stalk and contain between four and seven seeds, which are dark brown, flat and 5-8 mm in diameter. The taproot branches to 2 m depth.

English: Acacia catechu, Cutch tree, Black catechu, Black cutch, Cashoo, Catechu, Wadalee
Latin: Acacia catechu, Mimosa catechu, Acacia wallichiana
Assamese: খৈৰ, Kher
Bengali: খয়ের, খয়ের, Khayer
Gujarati: ખેર, Kher
Hindi: प्रियसख पेड़, पयोर, पथिद्रुम, मदन, खयर, खैर, गायत्रिन्, दन्त धावन, Khair, Dant dhavan, Gayatrin, Khayar, Madan, Pathi drum, Payor, Priya sakh
Kannada: ಕಗ್ಗಲಿ ಮರ, ಕಾದು, ಕದಿರ, ಕಾಚು, Kaachu, Kadira, Kadu, Kaggali
Konkani: खैर, Khair
Malayalam: ഖദിര, കരിങ്ങാലി, കരിണ്ടാലി, Karintaali, Acacia catechu
Marathi: यज्ञवृक्ष, खयर, खैर, Khair, Khayar, Yajnavrksha, Yajnavrksa
Nepali: खयर, Khayar
Punjabi: ਕੱਥਾ
Sanskrit: अश्वत्थः, खदिरवृक्षः, प्रियसख, पयोर, पथिद्रुम, खदिरः खादिरः, गायत्रिन्, Gayatrin, Khadira, Payor, Or khadira, Pathi-drum, Priya-sakh
Tamil: செங்கருங்காலி மரம், மாரோடம், கறை, காசுக்கட்டி, Chenkarungali, Kasukatti, Karai, Kacu-k-katti
Telugu: కాచు, నల్లచండ్ర, ఖదిరము కవిరిచండ్ర, Khadiramu, Kaviricandra, Nallacandra, Khadiramu. kaviricandra
Urdu: کهير, Khair
Color: Brown to Black; Deeply Cracked, and flaky, lifting in plates
